translated: Moberger, Elias Viktor, former high school inspector, Västervik, born on March 16, 1880 in Högsby, Kalmar County, son of prov. doctor Arvid M. and Adèle von Krusenstjerna. Married on March 16, 1900 to Karin Jiahnson-Blohm. Children: Olof, born in 1918, law graduate, lawyer, Karlskoga, Karin, born in 1920, Bachelor of Arts, Maria, born in 1930, student. He obtained a Bachelor's degree in Theology in Uppsala in 1906, passed the high school examination in Lund in 1910, studied at Leipzig University in 1911, obtained a Bachelor's degree in Lund in 1912. He was the rector of Osby high school from 1906 to 1910 and of Tro-Mihättans preparatory school from 1912 to 1914. He served as a high school inspector in the Gotland and Södertörn inspection districts from 1915 to 1919, and in the Northern Småland and Eastern Norrland inspection districts from 1920 to 1945. He was a member of the city council in Visby from 1917 to 1919, a member of the finance committee there in 1918-1919, a member of the second chamber of the parliament from 1918 to 1920, chairman of the second temporary committee from 1918 to 1920, substitute member of the constitutional committee in 1919, member of the business licensing committee from 1920 to 1924, chairman of the Västervik Liquor Wholesalers' Board in 1922, a member of the city council in 1923-1937, vice chairman from 1924 to 1937, chairman of the child welfare board from 1925 to 1927, member of the northern county council of Kalmar from 1928 to 1938 and of its administrative committee from 1931 to 1939, member of the church council in 1932, member of the board for the mentally disabled in Småland in 1934, chairman from 1939, chairman of the Northern Kalmar County Employment Agency, member of the board for Northern Kalmar County High School and Agricultural School in 1941, vice chairman in 1946. Received the Order of the Polar Star in 1931.
